text: あ、私 / じゃないわよ / どうだろうな
translation: Ah, it's not me! / How should I know?

vocabulary.meaning: I wonder, how should I know

grammar: わよ is a feminine sentence-ending particle adding emphasis. だろう expresses uncertainty or speculation.

text: でもまあ、すぐに予備電源に切り替わるわよ / ダメです、予備回線繋がりません / バカな、生き残っている回線は
translation: Well anyway, it'll switch to backup power right away / No good, the backup circuits won't connect / Impossible! What circuits are still alive?
grammar: に切り替わる uses に to mark the destination of the switch. 繋がりません is the polite negative form of 繋がる (to connect).

text: 全部で1.2% / 2567番からの9回戦だけで / 生き残っている電源は全てマギとセントラルドグマの維持に回せ / 前回の生命維持に支障が生じますが
translation: Only 1.2% in total / Just the 9 circuits from number 2567 / Route all surviving power to maintaining MAGI and Central Dogma / But that will cause problems with life support for the facilities
grammar: ている marks ongoing state (surviving). に回せ uses に to mark destination (route to). が at the end marks contrast or concern.

text: 構わん最優先だ
translation: It doesn't matter. It's top priority.
grammar: 構わん is the negative plain form of 構う with ん contraction (doesn't matter). だ is the copula marking assertion.

text: ほんとズボラな人だな / 桂木さんも自分の洗濯物ぐらい自分で取りに行きゃいいのに
translation: He's really such a sloppy person / Katsuragi-san should at least go get her own laundry herself
grammar: ぐらい means 'at least'. 行きゃいいのに is casual contraction of 行けばいいのに (should go), expressing mild criticism or suggestion.

text: あれ? / それは怒りしれ本当に忙しかっただけじゃないの / そっかな
translation: Huh? / Isn't it just that Ikari-san was really busy? / I wonder...
grammar: かっただけ combines past tense of い-adjective with だけ (just/only). じゃないの is a casual questioning form. そっかな shows uncertain agreement.

text: 途中で切ったっていうよりなんか故障した感じだったんだけど
translation: Rather than being cut off midway, it felt more like it malfunctioned somehow
grammar: っていう is casual form of という. より marks comparison (rather than). 感じだった expresses impression or feeling about something.

text: もう男のくせにいちいち細かいこと気にすんのやめたら
translation: Come on, you're a guy - why don't you stop worrying about every little detail?
grammar: くせに shows criticism (even though you're a guy). すんの is casual contraction of するの. やめたら is conditional suggestion (why don't you stop).

text: あれ
translation: Huh?
grammar: Interjection expressing mild surprise or confusion.

text: 何やってんのほら変わりなさいよ
translation: What are you doing? Come on, switch places!
grammar: やってんの is casual contraction of やっているの. なさい is polite imperative. よ adds emphasis to the command.

text: もう壊れてんじゃないのこれ
translation: Isn't this thing broken already?
grammar: 壊れてんじゃないの is casual contraction of 壊れているんじゃないの (isn't it broken?). んじゃない suggests suspicion or conjecture.

text: とにかく発令書へ急ぎましょう / 7分経っても普及しないなんて / ただごとじゃないわ / ここの電源は / 制服予備の3系統
translation: Anyway, let's hurry to the command center / The fact that it hasn't been restored even after 7 minutes... / This is no ordinary situation / The power here has / Three independent backup systems
grammar: ましょう is volitional form (let's). ても shows contrast (even though). なんて adds emphasis of disbelief. じゃない negates (not ordinary).

text: それが同時に落ちるなんて考えられないわ / となると
translation: It's unthinkable that they would all go down simultaneously / Which means...

vocabulary.meaning: when it comes to that, which means

grammar: なんて emphasizes disbelief. 考えられない is potential negative (cannot be thought of). となると transitions to logical conclusion.

text: やはりブレーカーは落ちたというより / 落とされたと考えるべきだな / 原因はどうであれ
translation: As expected, rather than the breakers going down / We should consider that they were taken down / Whatever the cause may be
grammar: というより shows comparison (rather than). られる is passive form (were taken down). べきだ expresses obligation/recommendation. であれ means 'whatever it is'.

text: こんな時に使徒が現れたら大変だぞ / 速的レーダーに正体不明の反応あり
translation: It'd be a disaster if an Angel appeared at a time like this / Unidentified response on long-range radar
grammar: たら conditional (if). だぞ is masculine emphatic particle. あり is formal way to say 'there is'.

text: 予想上陸地点は旧熱海方面 / おそらく8番目のやつだ / ああ使徒だろう / どうします / 一応警報シフトにしておけ / 決まりだからな
translation: Predicted landing point is in the old Atami area / Probably the eighth one / Yeah, must be an Angel / What should we do? / Put us on alert shift just in case / It's protocol after all
grammar: だろう expresses conjecture. しておけ is command form with ておく (do in advance). からな provides reasoning with masculine particle.

text: どうせまた奴の目的地は第三新東京市だ / そうだな
translation: Its destination is Tokyo-3 again anyway / That's right
grammar: どうせ expresses resignation or inevitability (anyway/regardless). だ is assertive copula. な is masculine agreement particle.

text: まあ俺たちがすることは何もないさ
translation: Well, there's nothing for us to do anyway
grammar: が marks subject. すること nominalizes the verb (thing to do). さ is casual masculine emphatic particle.

text: 首都上陸しました / 依然進行中 / 第三新東京市は / 地目を守っています
translation: It has made landfall / Still advancing / Tokyo-3 is / Maintaining silence
grammar: しました is polite past tense. 中 marks ongoing state. を守る means to maintain/keep.

text: 一体ネルフのレンチャーに何をやってるんだ / タラップなんて前時代的な飾りだと思っていたけど
translation: What the hell is NERV doing? / I thought stairs were just an old-fashioned decoration, but...
grammar: 一体 adds emphasis to questions (what on earth). なんて adds dismissive tone. だと思っていた is past progressive thought. けど shows contrast.

text: まさか使うことになるとはね / 備えあれば / 憂いなしですよ
translation: Who would have thought we'd actually use them / If you're prepared / There's nothing to worry about
grammar: ことになる means 'to come to (do something)'. とは emphasizes unexpectedness. あれば is conditional. なし means 'without'.

text: これも動かないわ / どの施設も動かない、おかしいわ / 下で何かあったってこと? / そう考えるのは自然ね
translation: This won't work either / None of the facilities are working, something's wrong / Does that mean something happened below? / It's natural to think so
grammar: も emphasizes 'even this'. どの～も means 'none of'. あったってこと is casual explanation pattern. のは nominalizes the verb.

text: とにかく、ネルフ本部へ連絡してみようよ
translation: Anyway, let's try contacting NERV headquarters
grammar: へ marks direction. してみよう is volitional of してみる (try doing). よ adds casual encouragement.

text: ダメだわ、非常電話も繋がらない
translation: No good, even the emergency phone won't connect
grammar: も emphasizes 'even'. わ is feminine sentence ending particle.

text: ダメです、77号線も繋がりません / ダメ、連絡つかない
translation: No good, line 77 won't connect either / No good, can't make contact
grammar: ません is polite negative. つかない is negative of つく (cannot reach/make contact).

text: こっちもダメ / 郵船の非常回線も消えちゃってる / どうしよう
translation: This one's no good too / Even the emergency circuits for communications have gone out / What should we do?
grammar: ちゃってる is casual contraction of てしまっている (completely has gone). どうしよう expresses worry about what to do.

text: 何してるの? / あったバカ!緊急時のマニュアルよ! / とにかく本部へ行きましょう / そうね!じゃあ行動開始の前にグループのリーダーを決めましょう
translation: What are you doing? / Found it, you idiot! It's the emergency manual! / Anyway, let's go to headquarters / Right! Well then, let's decide on a group leader before we start moving
grammar: あった is past tense of ある (there was/found it). の before に marks a time point. ましょう is polite volitional (let's).

text: で、当然私がリーダー!意義ないわね
translation: So, naturally I'm the leader! No objections, right?
grammar: で introduces the conclusion. が marks subject. ないわね is feminine confirmation seeking agreement (right?).

text: じゃあ行きましょう / こっちの第7ルートから下に入れるわ
translation: Well then, let's go / We can get down from Route 7 this way
grammar: じゃあ marks transition. から indicates source/starting point. に入れる means 'can enter into'. わ is feminine assertive particle.
